pageContext.claim: “Like I said at the debate. 91 percent to nine percent. You know what that means? They did polls afterwards. 91 a respected poll, 91 percent said -- I have to do it, I have to brag, you know why? They'll never do it. You know? You know? You know the expression, 'If you can't get anybody else to do it, do it yourself.' No, 91 percent to nine percent. And I'm trying to figure out, who is the nine? I wanna find who these people were. No, it was that it just uh, ridiculous. Ridiculous. I think they could have done better, but, you know, you never know.”
pageContext.analysis: We have no idea what poll Trump is referencing, if it exists, since he does not cite a pollster. Surveys by major pollsters showed Biden was considered the winner. A Politico/Morning Consult flash poll found that 54 percent of debate watchers believed Biden won the matchup, while 39 percent said Trump did. YouGov found that Biden won 54 per cent to 35 percent against Trump. A Data for Progress progressive poll gave the win to the former vice president with 52 per cent of support over the 41 percent going for Trump. And a CNN instant poll found that 53 per cent of debate watchers thought Biden won the debate over the president, who earned support from 39 percent of viewers.
